intro: Calcitrapa centauroides, commonly known as the centaur's shield, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology, including the shield-like structure of its leaves, gives it its common name. Calcitrapa centauroides is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
